Francesca Mondino is a supporting antagonist in Quentin Tarantino's sixth film, "Inglourious Basterds". She is Joseph Goebbels' French interpreter as well as his mistress. She seemed to care for Goebbels, as shown when she comforts him in the scene where he is crying.

She was portrayed by Julie Dreyfus who also played Sofie Fatale in "Kill Bill: Volume 1"

Biography[]

Background informations[]

She was born in France.

Chapter Three - GERMAN NIGHT IN PARIS[]

Francesca is first seen at the restaurant where Joseph Goebbels and Frederick Zoller were having dinner. Here she acts as translator for Emmanuelle Mimieux. After, she and Goebbels leave for their "next appointment".

Chapter Five - REVENGE OF THE GIANT FACE[]

Francesca is seen at the Stolz der Nation premiere, in Shosanna's cinema lobby, with Goebbels, Zoller Emil Jannings and later Shosanna. After all the crowd is announced to go and occupy their seats, Francesca is seen with Goebbels in their opera box, listening to his jokes. Here she comforts Goebbels when the latter begins to cry after Hitler congratulated him on his latest film. When Omar and Donny burst in Hitler's lounge, she was killed by Omar Ulmer, who emptied an entire magazine in her stomach.

Personality[]

She and Goebbels had an affair.

Trivia[]
